tr.td: Overexpressed Sirt3-FLAG was found in mitochondrial extraction.
Endogenous Sirt3 was detected in mitochondrial fraction with rabbit sirt3 antiserum (anti-sirt3 C term 15 AAs).
Overexpressed Sirt3-EGFP was detected in mitochondria by immunoelectron microscopy.
Overexpressed full length Sirt3-EGFP was present in mitochondria
Overexpressed Sirt3-GFP was detected in mitochondria.
There was no detectable signal of overexpressed Sirt3 with N-term-HA tag by immunofluorescence.
Overexpressed of Sirt3-V5-His with C-term-tag was detected in mitochondria by immunofluorescence.
Sirt3-V5-His was detected in mitochondrial extraction using anti-V5 antibody.
Overexpressed mSirt3-FLAG was detected in mitochondria by immunofluorescence.
Co-expression of AceCS1/2 with Sirt3-FLAG down-regulated acetylation level on AceCS2 (in mitochondria), but not AceCS1 (in nucleus).
Endogenous Sirt3 was detected in mitochondrial extraction using anti-sirt3 C-term serum.
AceCS2-FLAG localized in mitochondria. Endogenous Sirt3 was co-precipitated from cell stably expressing AceCS2-FLAG using anti-FLAG antibody.
Overexpression of Sirt3-FLAG down-regulated acetylation level on AceCS2.
Overexpressed Sirt3-myc was detected in mitochondria by immunofluorescence.
Overexpressed Sir3-Myc was detected in mitochondrial extraction using anti-Myc antibody.
Co-expression of Sirt5-FLAG with Sirt3-Myc promoted translocation of Sirt3 into nucleus.
Overexpressed Sirt3-Myc could be detected in total lysate but not in post-nuclear supernatant after co-expression with Sirt5-FLAG.
Sirt3-Myc with mitochondria targeting signal (72-75) mutant to 4 Ala was found in in both nucleus and cytoplasm.
Sirt3-Myc with nuclear targeting signal (214-216) mutant to 3 Ala was detected in nucleus and cytoplasm when co-expressed with Sirt5.
Endogenous Sirt3 was detected in mitochondria isolation using anti-Sirt3 C-term antibody.
Overexpressed Sirt3-FLAG or Sirt3-Myc was detected in mitochondria by immunofluorescence.
LMB treatment did not result in nuclear translocation of Sirt3-FLAG but did for HDAC7.
Overexpressed POLG2-HA, a positive control for mitochondrial localized proteins, was detected in mitochondria isolation, by not for Sirt3-FLAG.
Full length Sirt3 was detected in all subcellular fractionation parts.
Endogenous Sirt3 was detected in nucleus by microscopy.
Overexpressed Sirt3 was detected in nucleus by immunofluorescence.
Full length Sirt3 was detected in nuclear extraction using anti-Sirt3 antibody.
Ku70, a nuclear protein, could be co-precipitated by anti-Sirt3 antibody.
Ku70 was co-precipitated with FLAG antibody from Sirt3-FLAG expressing cells but not from cells expressing the FLAG tag alone.
Sirt3 was pulled down with Ku70 using anti-Ku70 antibody.
Precipitation of recombinant Ku70 by recombinant Sirt3 verified their direct interaction in vitro.
Acetylation level on Ku70 was reduced by overexpressed Sirt3 and enhanced by Sirt3 knockdown via RNAi.
Sirt3 was capable of deacetylation on Ku70 to enhance Ku70/Bax bindig to prevent cell death.
Endogenous full-length Sirt3 was detected in nucleus by immunofluorescence using anti-Sirt3 N-term antibody.
Co-transfection of Gal4-Sirt3 and luciferase reporter plasmid showed the nucleus localization of Gal4-Sirt3.
Full length Sirt3 resided in the nucleus and expelled from nucleus upon cellular stress.
The synthesis of tetracycline-inducible Sirt3 harboring a C-term HA-tag is processed in the nucleus.
Overexpressed Sirt3-HA was detected in nuclear extraction.
Stress-induced the degradation of full-length Sirt3 in nuclei.
SIRT3 localizes to defined chromatin regions and regulates gene expression.
Interaction of endogenous Sirt3 and SKP2, a protein found outside mitochondria, was validated by immunoprecipitation.
